newsitem.title: UK: DTB-New Euromark futures to pull trade from LIFFE.
newsitem.headline: DTB-New Euromark futures to pull trade from LIFFE.

text.p: Deutsche Terminboerse (DTB) board member Joerg Franke said on Thursday the planned introduction of new one- and three-month Euromark futures would help the German exchange attract business away from London.

"The new Euromark futures will enable DTB participants to trade the entire deutschemark yield curve from one month to 10 years," Franke told a news conference in London. "We can offer a one stop shop."
DTB's new one-month future will be launched on November 12, while a new three-month Euromark contract is due for launch on January 14.

Citing a number of differences between the DTB and its rival, the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE), Franke said the DTB contracts would be competitive with LIFFE's existing three-month future and with a new one-month LIFFE product due for launch on November 21.
He said DTB's market-making structure, its electronic trading system and the existing over-the-counter (OTC) market in Germany would aid the success of the new contracts.

"The OTC market needs a complementary market on the exchange," Franke said in a prepared speech. "It has been suggested that up to 20 percent of LIFFE's trading volume in the three-month Euromark future is done by German players. Why shouldn't they trade though DTB?"

Franke said the DTB expected to have more than 50 percent of the trading volume in the new one-month contract while also bringing "at least the percentage of LIFFE's trading volume in the three-month Euromark future that is made by German members" back to Germany.
